sections.title: Wetlands & Rivers
sections.text: The Philippine crocodile thrives in freshwater wetlands, rivers, and small lakes in Northern Luzon. These areas provide food and shelter, yet are under threat from human activity.

sections.title: Forested Areas
sections.text: Forests surrounding rivers play a vital role in maintaining the ecological balance. Protecting trees ensures clean water and shelter for both crocodiles and local communities.

cta.title: Help Protect Their Habitat
cta.text: Every action counts. By supporting the Mabuwaya Foundation, you help conserve one of the most endangered crocodile species in the world.
